humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides a tumor size of 4 x 2.2 x 1.6 cm for the invasive lobular carcinoma. According to the rules provided, T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. The tumor size in this report falls within this range, so the pathologic T stage of the patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, the tumor size is described as 4 x 2.2 x 1.6 cm. The T stage is determined by the greatest dimension of the tumor. In this case, the greatest dimension is 4 cm. According to the TNM staging system, a T2 stage is defined as a tumor that is 2-5 cm in size. Therefore, the T stage for this patient is T2.
